result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Christopher Fountain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND THREE:  Pay all court costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.  To be paid during period of probation.   Failure to pay will result in entry of a civil judgment.
Credit for 202 days.  Time served disposition with good time credit ordered applied by the Court.

AS TO COUNTS TWO AND FOUR:   Pay all court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.  Credit for 127 days.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting priviletges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 202 days.  Time seved disposition  with good time credit ordered applied by the Court.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.  
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under 973.05 (4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

**Restitution set at zero.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Sex offender assessment and treatment.
Register as a sex offender for 15 years pursuant to 973.048.
Pay all court costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in counts one and three to be paid during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
AODA and other counseling  needs to be determined. Random urine screens.  Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Christopher Fountain

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Counts two and four.
Counts one and three.
Original Transcript of SENTENCING (27 pages) commencing DECEMBER 4, 2014, received and filed.  jm
At request of the state, defendant's address to be reflected as House of Correction, not address of victim's family.  So ordered by the court.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric Christopher Fountain
Current: 8885 S. 68th St., Franklin, WI   (Effective: 12-04-2014)
Prior: 2423 West Scott Street, #a, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion with counsels.
Defense sentencing memorandum is given to court to review prior to case being called.
Parties are prepared to proceed.
  Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado for mother of victim
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, Zulma P. (via interpreter), defense and defendant.
As to count 1,  Fourth degree sexual assault:  
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 202 days time served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION WITH GOOD TIME CREDIT ORDERED APPLIED BY THE COURT.
The court orders the payment of all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation imposed in count 4; failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
As to count 2, Exposing genitals to a child:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 127 days time served, consecutive to count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
As to count 3, Fourth degree sexual assault:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1 with credit for 202 days time served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION WITH GOOD TIME CREDIT ORDERED APPLIED BY THE COURT.
The court orders the payment of all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation imposed in count 4; failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
As to count 4, Exposing genitals to a child:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  Conditions of probation include:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Court sets restitution at ZERO.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.  Court ordered that all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in counts 1 & 3 in paid during period of probation; failure to pay will result in entry of civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Mental health assessment and treatment.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Register as a sex offender for 15 years pursuant to 973.048.
-No contact with victim DOP, dob 1-29-2003, or his family.
-No unsupervised contact with children under 18 years.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Filed:  Notice of right to seek postconviction relief; ineligible voting notice; pretrial incarceration credit; written explanation of determinate sentence

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Eric Christopher Fountain not in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting that sentencing be adjourned 2-3 weeks to allow for completion of defense psi.
Case is adjourned to 12-4-2014 at 8:15

Atty Carpenter contacted the court to advise that defense will be requesting an additional 2-3 weeks for completion of defense psi (staff shortage in Public Defender office).
New sentencing date to be set on 11-14-2014.  ADA Mathy will be contacted by Atty Carpenter.

Atty Carpenter is requesting that sentencing date be adjourned to allow for completion of sentencing investigation from SPD.  State by ADA Mathy has no objection.  Case is adjourned to 11-14-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.

As to Counts 1, 2, 3, and 4 on the THIRD INFORMATION:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Court REMANDS defendant and adjourns sentencing to Branch 38.

Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for Jury trial.  Parties have reached a resolution and proceed with plea hearing.  Third Information received and filed. 

Count 1:  Fourth Degree Sexual Assault contrary to Wis. Stats. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Count 2:  Exposing Genitals or Pubic Area contrary to Wis. Stats. 948.10(1) and (1)(a), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony. 
Count 3:  Fourth Degree Sexual Assault contrary to Wis. Stats. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Count 4:  Exposing Genitals or Pubic Area contrary to Wis. Stats. 948.10(1) and (1)(a), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.

Defense counsel waived reading of the Third Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:15 am.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Eric Christopher Fountain not in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter remains in trial posture for 8-25-2014.

Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to adjourn May 19 jury trial heard.  Atty Carpenter states that due to his workload he has not been able to prepare for this trial and that there are witnesses that need to be investigated.
State does not object to adjournment.  Court will GRANT the adjournment.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-5-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 8-25-2014 at 8:15am.
Defense will be requesting adjournment of jury trial on 5-19-2014.  ADA Mathy to appear on 5-15-2014.
filed by the State.

Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AMENDED Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case remains on for trial on 5-19-2014.
State's Motion in Limine / States Witness List / notice of Intent to Introduce Video-Recorder Statement and Motion to Seal Video received and filed.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Eric Christopher Fountain not in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs to review and investigate case.   Case set for final pretrial on 4-1-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-19-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 2-24-2014.    All discovery is to be completed by 3-5-2014; Witness Lists to be filed by 4-1-2014.  Any evidentiary motions to be heard on final pretrial date.  ls  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Due to extreme cold weather, courts are closed on 1-28-2014.  This matter is adjourned to 2-3-2015 at 8:15am.

Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in custody.  Denis Stingl for Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.O.P. (DOB:  01/29/2003) and Z.P.S. (DOB:  11/25/1977).

Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Eric Christopher Fountain in custody.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
